Gent|Gent]] | clubnumber = 10 | youthyears1 = | youthclubs1 = [[Strindheim]] | youthyears2 = | youthclubs2 = [[Rosenborg BK|Rosenborg]] | years1 = 2012–2015 | clubs1 = [[Rosenborg BK 2|Rosenborg 2]] | caps1 = 46 | goals1 = 18 | years2 = 2013–2015 | clubs2 = [[Rosenborg BK|Rosenborg]] | caps2 = 6 | goals2 = 0 | years3 = 2015 | clubs3 = → [[FK Bodø/Glimt|Bodø/Glimt]] (loan) | caps3 = 26 | goals3 = 13 | years4 = 2016–2017 | clubs4 = [[FC Groningen]] | caps4 = 38 | goals4 = 5 | years5 = 2017–2018 | clubs5 = [[FC Midtjylland]] | caps5 = 19 | goals5 = 10 | years6 = 2018– | clubs6 = [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]] | caps6 = 16 | goals6 = 0 | clubs7 = → [[K.A.A. Gent|Gent]] (loan) | years7 = 2019– | caps7 = 7 | goals7 = 3 | nationalyears1 = 2011 | nationalteam1 = Norway U16 | nationalcaps1 = 3 | nationalgoals1 = 0 | nationalyears2 = 2012 | nationalteam2 = [[Norway national under-17 football team|Norway U17]] | nationalcaps2 = 3 | nationalgoals2 = 0 | nationalyears3 = 2013 | nationalteam3 = Norway U18 | nationalcaps3 = 11 | nationalgoals3 = 5 | nationalyears4 = 2014 | nationalteam4 = [[Norway national under-19 football team|Norway U19]] | nationalcaps4 = 3 | nationalgoals4 = 1 | nationalyears5 = 2015–2016 | nationalteam5 = [[Norway national under-21 football team|Norway U21]] | nationalcaps5 = 10 | nationalgoals5 = 1 | nationalyears6 = 2016– | nationalteam6 = [[Norway national football team|Norway]] | nationalcaps6 = 17 | nationalgoals6 = 2 | club-update = 2 March 2019 | nationalteam-update = 19 November 2018 }} '''Alexander Sørloth''' (born 5 December 1995) is a Norwegian [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Forward (Association football)|striker]] for [[K.A.A. Gent]] on loan from [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]], and for the [[Norway national football team|Norway national team]].
==Career==
===Rosenborg=== After several years in the youth system Sørloth was rewarded with a contract by Rosenborg in July 2013. He played his first professional game for Rosenborg when he was subbed on in the second half of the [[2013-14 UEFA Europa League|Europa League]] first qualifying round game versus [[Crusaders FC|Crusaders]], and it took him only 12 minutes to score his first goal, Rosenborg's 6th in their 7–2 win.
He made his debut in the [[Tippeligaen]] on 20 July 2014 in Rosenborg's home game against [[Sogndal Fotball|Sogndal]] coming on as a substitute for [[Alexander Søderlund]] after 60 minutes.<ref name=RefA>{{cite web|url=http://www.aftenbladet.no/100Sport/fotball/eliteserien/Debutant-Sorloth---Jeg-burde-kanskje-hatt-en-scoring-448821_1.snd|title=Debutant Sørloth: – Jeg burde kanskje hatt en scoring|publisher=|accessdate=1 February 2018|subscription=y|language=no}}</ref>
Sørloth went on a loan to [[FK Bodø/Glimt|Bodø/Glimt]] before the start of the 2015 [[Tippeligaen]]. He quickly became one of the best players in the team and one of the best players in the league scoring 13 goals and making 5 assist in his 26 appearances (19 starters), including scoring six goals in one game against [[Sarpsborg 08 FF|Sarpsborg 08]].<ref name=RefA/> In his last match for [[FK Bodø/Glimt|Bodø/Glimt]], he scored his second hat-trick of the season, against Stabæk.
===Groningen=== On 6 November 2015, Sørloth confirmed that he would be joining [[FC Groningen]] on a 4.5-year contract at the end of the season. [[FC Groningen]] paid a transfer fee of around €750,000.
===Midtjylland=== On 1 June 2017, [[FC Midtjylland]] announced that they had signed a four-year contract with Alexander Sørloth.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.fcm.dk/nyheder/fcm-tv/--vi-faar-endnu-en-klasseangriber|title=- Vi får endnu en klasseangriber|website=www.fcm.dk|accessdate=1 February 2018}}</ref>
===Crystal Palace=== On 31 January 2018, Sørloth signed for [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]] for a reported fee of £9 million.<ref name="CPannounce">{{cite web|url=https://www.cpfc.co.uk/news/2018/february/sorloth-is-new-eagles-number-nine/|title=Crystal Palace FC Sørloth Is New Eagles Number Nine|publisher=|accessdate=1 February 2018}}</ref> He made his debut on 10 February 2018 in a 3–1 defeat to Everton.<ref>{{cite web |title=Sørloth Not Satisfied After Debut |url=https://www.cpfc.co.uk/news/2018/february/sorloth-not-satisfied-after-debut/ |website=cpfc.co.uk |publisher=Crystal Palace F.C. |accessdate=3 June 2018 |date=10 February 2018}}</ref> On Tuesday 28 August, Sørloth scored his first goal for [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]] in a Carabao Cup game against Swansea City with the game finishing 1–0.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2018/08/28/alexander-sorloth-fires-first-crystal-palace-goal-see-swansea/|title=Alexander Sorloth fires first Crystal Palace goal to see off Swansea in Carabao Cup|accessdate=1 December 2018}}</ref>
===K.A.A. Gent=== On 8 January 2019, Sørloth signed for [[Belgian First Division A]] side, [[K. A. A. Gent|Gent]] on loan until the end of the 2018–19 season.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.cpfc.co.uk/news/2019/january/alexander-sorloth-to-join-kaa-gent-for-a-season-long-loan/|title=Alexander Sørloth Joins KAA Gent on Loan|website=cpfc.co.uk|date=8 January 2018|accessdate=8 January 2019}}</ref>
==Personal life== He is the son of former Rosenborg player and Norwegian international [[Gøran Sørloth]].<ref name="CPannounce"/>
